verses.verse: My son,<WH1121> if<WH518> you be surety<WH6148> for your friend,<WH7453> if you have stricken<WH8628> your hand<WH3709> with a stranger,<WH2114>
You are snared<WH3369> with the words<WH561> of your mouth,<WH6310> you are taken<WH3920> with the words<WH561> of your mouth.<WH6310>

Do<WH6213> this<WH2063> now,<WH645> my son,<WH1121> and deliver<WH5337> yourself, when<WH3588> you are come<WH935> into the hand<WH3709> of your friend;<WH7453> go,<WH3212> humble<WH7511> yourself, and make sure<WH7292> your friend.<WH7453>
Give<WH5414> not sleep<WH8142> to your eyes,<WH5869> nor slumber<WH8572> to your eyelids.<WH6079>
Deliver<WH5337> yourself as a roe<WH6643> from the hand<WH3027> of the hunter,<WH6718> and as a bird<WH6833> from the hand<WH3027> of the fowler.<WH3353>
Go<WH3212> to the ant,<WH5244> you sluggard;<WH6102> consider<WH7200> her ways,<WH1870> and be wise:<WH2449>
Which<WH834> having no<WH369> guide,<WH7101> overseer,<WH7860> or ruler,<WH4910>
Provides<WH3559> her meat<WH3899> in the summer,<WH7019> and gathers<WH103> her food<WH3978> in the harvest.<WH7105>
How<WH5704> long<WH5704> will you sleep,<WH7901> O sluggard?<WH6102> when<WH4970> will you arise<WH6965> out of your sleep?<WH8142>
Yet a little<WH4592> sleep,<WH8142> a little<WH4592> slumber,<WH8572> a little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to sleep:<WH7901>
So shall your poverty<WH7389> come<WH935> as one that travels,<WH1980> and your want<WH4270> as an armed<WH4043> man.<WH376>
A naughty<WH1100> person,<WH120> a wicked<WH205> man,<WH376> walks<WH1980> with a fraudulent<WH6143> mouth.<WH6310>
He winks<WH7169> with his eyes,<WH5869> he speaks<WH4448> with his feet,<WH7272> he teaches<WH3384> with his fingers;<WH676>
Frowardness<WH8419> is in his heart,<WH3820> he devises<WH2790> mischief<WH7451> continually;<WH6256> he sows<WH7971> discord.<WH4066>
Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> shall his calamity<WH343> come<WH935> suddenly;<WH6597> suddenly<WH6621> shall he be broken<WH7665> without<WH369> remedy.<WH4832>
These<WH2007> six<WH8337> things does the LORD<WH3068> hate:<WH8130> yes, seven<WH7651> are an abomination<WH8441> to him:
A proud<WH7311> look,<WH5869> a lying<WH8267> tongue,<WH3956> and hands<WH3027> that shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood,<WH1818>
An heart<WH3820> that devises<WH2790> wicked<WH205> imaginations,<WH4284> feet<WH7272> that be swift<WH4116> in running<WH7323> to mischief,<WH7451>
A false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> that speaks<WH6315> lies,<WH3576> and he that sows<WH7971> discord<WH4090> among<WH996> brothers.<WH251>
My son,<WH1121> keep<WH5341> your father's<WH1> commandment,<WH4687> and forsake<WH5203> not the law<WH8451> of your mother:<WH517>
Bind<WH7194> them continually<WH8548> on your heart,<WH3820> and tie<WH6029> them about<WH5921> your neck.<WH1621>
When you go,<WH1980> it shall lead<WH5148> you; when you sleep,<WH7901> it shall keep<WH8104> you; and when you wake,<WH6974> it shall talk<WH7878> with you.
For the commandment<WH4687> is a lamp;<WH5216> and the law<WH8451> is light;<WH216> and reproofs<WH8433> of instruction<WH4148> are the way<WH1870> of life:<WH2416>
To keep<WH8104> you from the evil<WH7451> woman,<WH802> from the flattery<WH2513> of the tongue<WH3956> of a strange<WH5237> woman.
Lust<WH2530> not after her beauty<WH3308> in your heart;<WH3824> neither<WH408> let her take<WH3947> you with her eyelids.<WH6079>
For by means<WH1157> of a whorish<WH2181> woman<WH802> a man is brought to a piece<WH3603> of bread:<WH3899> and the adulteress<WH802> <WH376> will hunt<WH6679> for the precious<WH3368> life.<WH5315>
Can a man<WH376> take<WH2846> fire<WH784> in his bosom,<WH2436> and his clothes<WH899> not be burned?<WH8313>
Can one<WH376> go<WH1980> on hot coals,<WH1513> and his feet<WH7272> not be burned?<WH3554>
So<WH3651> he that goes<WH935> in to his neighbor's<WH7453> wife;<WH802> whoever<WH3605> touches<WH5060> her shall not be innocent.<WH5352>
Men do not despise<WH936> a thief,<WH1590> if<WH3588> he steal<WH1589> to satisfy<WH4390> his soul<WH5315> when<WH3588> he is hungry;<WH7456>
But if he be found,<WH4672> he shall restore<WH7999> sevenfold;<WH7659> he shall give<WH5414> all<WH3605> the substance<WH1952> of his house.<WH1004>
But whoever commits<WH5003> adultery<WH5003> with a woman<WH802> lacks<WH2638> understanding:<WH3820> he that does<WH6213> it destroys<WH7843> his own soul.<WH5315>
A wound<WH5061> and dishonor<WH7036> shall he get;<WH4672> and his reproach<WH2781> shall not be wiped<WH4229> away.
For jealousy<WH7068> is the rage<WH2534> of a man:<WH1397> therefore he will not spare<WH2550> in the day<WH3117> of vengeance.<WH5359>
He will not regard<WH5375> <WH6440> any<WH3605> ransom;<WH3724> neither<WH3808> will he rest content,<WH14> though<WH3588> you give many<WH7235> gifts.<WH7810>
